ai.summary: Daisy Walk is a tiny, easy stroll in the UK. At 0.2 km, it offers a gentle introduction to walking and is suitable for most ages and fitness levels.
ai.terrain_summary: A flat, well-maintained route, typically on pavement or compact gravel. The short distance makes it a level, easy walk with minimal elevation.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast before you go and wear comfortable shoes. This is a short walk, but slopes, uneven patches, rain, or crowded areas can present risks. Keep children and pets under supervision, stay on the path, and carry contact information and a phone. In winter, daylight hours are shorter and surfaces can be slick.
ai.best_seasons: Year-round in the UK; the conditions are typically most pleasant from late spring to early autumn.
